meanings.definition: The state or quality of being parfocal.
meanings.sent1: The parfocalities of the binoculars allowed for clear viewing at different distances.
meanings.sent2: The parfocalities of the microscope made it easy to switch between magnifications without losing focus.
meanings.sent3: The scientist marveled at the parfocalities of the telescope, making stargazing a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like the parfocalities of a camera lens, always sharp and focused.
meanings.sent5: The parfocalities of the glasses were so precise that every detail was crystal clear.

meanings.definition: The ability of different lenses or optical systems to maintain focus on the same point when magnification is changed.
meanings.sent1: When adjusting the zoom, the parfocalities of the camera lens ensured the image stayed sharp.
meanings.sent2: Photographers appreciate the parfocalities of high-quality lenses for consistent focus in various shots.
meanings.sent3: The detective's magnifying glass had remarkable parfocalities, helping him solve the case.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like parfocalities, always adjusting to see things clearly no matter the distance.
meanings.sent5: The parfocalities of the binoculars were so reliable that birdwatching became a delightful experience.
